awd_titl_txt: SGER:  Improvement of the Superconductor-Metal Interface by Halogen Doping
awd_abstract_narration: 9521888  Mukhopadyay    This  project  is  aimed at exploring a new  and  innovative  method  of  tailoring the superconductor-metal interface  by  doping the surface of the superconducting oxide with bromine  which  was  found  to modify its chemical  interaction  with  metals.   Ag-superconductor composite samples  with  undoped  and  halogen-doped superconducting oxides will  be  prepared  and  comparison of  their physical properties  (Jc  ,  Tc  ,  microstructure  and how each property changes  with  thermal  and  electrical  cycling)  will  be  made.   This  study  if  successful,  will  provide a new dopant for superconductors,  which will improve the overall oxide-metal composites.  %%%  Surface  treatment of oxide superconductors by bromine  will  be  tested.  If successful, it will provide a new method for  achieving    high   quality   and   of   better   properties  superconductor:  metal composites.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
